text:
build.sh script shouldn't be in DOS format, the script can't execute on Linux
platforms.

The error message given by bash is the following
bash: ./build.sh: No such file or directory

The solution is to clean this script of every '\r' characters.
Programs like dos2unix can do it.
Or do the following:
$ sed -e 's/^M$//' < build.sh > build.sh.tmp
$ mv build.sh.tmp build.sh

Shell scripts containing '\r' execute themselves fine on a Microsoft platform
with Unix tools like the Cygwin tools.
But not on Linux platforms.
creator: ma.darche@free.fr
